required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Absorption of Indacaterol and Glycopyrronium From Ultibro Breezhaler
clinical_study.official_title: A Pharmacokinetic Feasibility Study on Ultibro Breezhaler, an Indacaterol-glycopyrronium Inhalation Powder Capsule, in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to assess pharmacokinetics (PK) of indacaterol and glycopyrronium, and methodology and practical arrangements for future studies.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The study is a 2-part crossover study where the study subjects participate either in part 1 (18 subjects) or in part 2 (16 subjects). The parts can run in sequence or in parallel. The study subjects in part 1 receive single doses of Ultibro Breezhaler on 3 periods and the study subjects in part 2 receive single doses of Ultibro Breezhaler on 2 periods.

primary_outcome.measure: Indacaterol area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to 30 minutes (AUC30min)
Glycopyrronium area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to 30 minutes (AUC30min)
Indacaterol area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to 72 hours (AUC72h)
Glycopyrronium area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to 72 hours (AUC72h)

secondary_outcome.measure: Indacaterol area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to the last sample with a quantifiable concentration (AUCt)
Glycopyrronium area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to the last sample with a quantifiable concentration (AUCt)
Indacaterol area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to infinity (AUCinf)
Glycopyrronium area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to infinity (AUCinf)
Time to reach peak indacaterol concentration in plasma
Time to reach peak glycopyrronium concentration in plasma
Number of adverse events as event counts and subjects counts

criteria.textblock:
Main inclusion criteria:
1. Healthy males and females
2. 18-60 years of age
3. Body mass index 19-30 kg/m2
4. Weight at least 50 kg
5. Written informed consent obtained
Main exclusion criteria:
1. Evidence of a clinically significant cardiovascular, renal, hepatic, haematological, GI, pulmonary, metabolic, endocrine, neurological or psychiatric disease
2. Any condition requiring regular concomitant treatment
3. Any clinically significant abnormal laboratory value, vital sign or physical finding that in the opinion of the investigator could interfere with the interpretation of study results or cause a health risk for the subject
4. Known hypersensitivity to indacaterol or glycopyrronium
5. Pregnant or lactating females and females of childbearing potential not using contraception of acceptable effectiveness
6. Blood donation or loss of significant amount of blood within 90 days prior to the first study treatment administration
